moves.1. e4: Opening up the queen and f1 bishop and controlling d5.
moves.1... e5: A common response, the king pawn game.
moves.2. Nf3: Attacking the pawn and leading to several common openings.
moves.2... Nc6: Protecting the pawn.  Other moves are d6 (Philidor) or Nf6 (Petrov).
moves.3. d4: The Scotch Opening.  Planning dxe5, winning a pawn.
moves.3... exd4: Destroying the threat and the d4 pawn.
moves.4. Nxd4: Recapturing and putting a knight in the center of the board.
moves.4... Nxd4: Not the best move.  This allows the white queen to come to a powerful post at d4.  Better is Bc5 or Nf6.
moves.5... Qf6: Black is hoping for Qxf6 Nxf6 or a retreat of the queen.
moves.6. e5: This is a good move that wins a tempo for white.
moves.6... Qg6: A move that tries to avoid giving up a tempo by threatening the c2 pawn.  If Qb6 Qxb6 and Nc3 or Qc6 Nc3 or Qe6 Bc4.
moves.7. Nc3: Developing with tempo.  The pawn is not as undefended as it seems.
moves.7... Qxc2: ?? Black greedily snatches the c pawn.
moves.8. Bd3: Black resigns as his queen is trapped.

gameName: An Opening Trap for the Greedy
